reading_literature.description: Text analysis and literary comprehension through classic story adaptation

RL.6.2.title: Theme and Central Ideas
RL.6.2.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

app_support.how_supported: Students analyze classic stories and reflect on how their modifications affect original themes and meanings

RL.7.2.title: Theme Development Analysis
RL.7.2.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

app_support.how_supported: Students track how themes evolve when stories are adapted to new settings and contexts

RL.8.2.title: Theme Analysis and Summary
RL.8.2.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to the characters, setting, and plot; provide an objective summary of the text.

app_support.how_supported: Students analyze complex relationships between theme, character, setting, and plot in adaptations

RL.6.3.title: Plot and Character Analysis
RL.6.3.description: Describe how a particular story's or drama's plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

app_support.how_supported: Students analyze how character responses change when placed in new settings and situations

RL.7.3.title: Literary Element Interactions
RL.7.3.description: Analyze how particular elements of a story or drama interact (e.g., how setting shapes the characters or plot).

app_support.how_supported: Students explore how changing settings affects character behavior and plot development in their adaptations

RL.8.3.title: Story Development Analysis
RL.8.3.description: Analyze how particular lines of dialogue or incidents in a story or drama propel the action, reveal aspects of a character, or provoke a decision.

app_support.how_supported: Students create dialogue and incidents that drive their adapted stories forward while maintaining character integrity

RL.6.6.title: Point of View Analysis
RL.6.6.description: Explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

app_support.how_supported: Students consider how point of view changes when adapting stories to new contexts and narrators

RL.7.6.title: Author's Perspective Development
RL.7.6.description: Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters or narrators in a text.

app_support.how_supported: Students explore how different character perspectives work in their adapted stories

RL.8.6.title: Contrasting Perspectives
RL.8.6.description: Analyze how differences in the points of view of the characters and the audience or reader (e.g., created through the use of dramatic irony) create such effects as suspense or humor.

app_support.how_supported: Students create dramatic effects through perspective choices in their story adaptations

writing.description: Narrative and creative writing through story adaptation and creation

W.6.3.title: Narrative Writing
W.6.3.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

app_support.how_supported: Students write narrative adaptations with guided structure, character development, and descriptive details

sub_standards.W.6.3.a: Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.
sub_standards.W.6.3.b: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.
sub_standards.W.6.3.c: Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.
sub_standards.W.6.3.d: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey experiences and events.
sub_standards.W.6.3.e: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

W.7.3.title: Advanced Narrative Writing
W.7.3.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

app_support.how_supported: Students create sophisticated narrative adaptations with advanced techniques and complex character development

sub_standards.W.7.3.a: Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.
sub_standards.W.7.3.b: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.
sub_standards.W.7.3.c: Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.
sub_standards.W.7.3.d: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.
sub_standards.W.7.3.e: Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

W.8.3.title: Sophisticated Narrative Writing
W.8.3.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

app_support.how_supported: Students produce sophisticated narrative adaptations with complex techniques and nuanced character development

sub_standards.W.8.3.a: Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.
sub_standards.W.8.3.b: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, and reflection, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.
sub_standards.W.8.3.c: Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence, signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another, and show the relationships among experiences and events.
sub_standards.W.8.3.d: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.
sub_standards.W.8.3.e: Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

W.6.4.title: Clear and Coherent Writing
W.6.4.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

app_support.how_supported: Students produce age-appropriate story adaptations with clear organization and purpose

W.7.4.title: Task-Appropriate Writing
W.7.4.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

app_support.how_supported: Students create well-organized narrative adaptations appropriate for educational and creative purposes

W.8.4.title: Advanced Writing Production
W.8.4.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

app_support.how_supported: Students produce sophisticated, well-crafted narrative adaptations with advanced organizational and stylistic choices

speaking_listening.description: Collaborative discussion and presentation through story sharing and feedback

SL.6.1.title: Collaborative Discussions
SL.6.1.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 6 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

app_support.how_supported: Could be supported through story sharing features or classroom discussion prompts

SL.7.1.title: Advanced Collaborative Discussions
SL.7.1.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 7 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

app_support.how_supported: Could be supported through advanced story sharing and collaborative writing features

SL.8.1.title: Sophisticated Collaborative Discussions
SL.8.1.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 8 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

app_support.how_supported: Could be supported through sophisticated sharing and presentation features

SL.6.4.title: Presentation Skills
SL.6.4.description: Present claims and findings, sequencing ideas logically and using pertinent descriptions, facts, and details to accentuate main ideas or themes; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

app_support.how_supported: Could be supported through story presentation features and reflection sharing

SL.7.4.title: Advanced Presentation
SL.7.4.description: Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

app_support.how_supported: Could be supported through advanced presentation features and structured sharing

SL.8.4.title: Sophisticated Presentation
SL.8.4.description: Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with relevant evidence, sound valid reasoning, and well-chosen details; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

app_support.how_supported: Could be supported through sophisticated presentation tools and evidence integration

language.description: Language conventions and vocabulary through writing support and literary analysis

L.6.3.title: Language Knowledge and Use
L.6.3.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

app_support.how_supported: Students practice proper language conventions in their narrative writing and adaptations

L.7.3.title: Advanced Language Use
L.7.3.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

app_support.how_supported: Students apply advanced language conventions in sophisticated narrative adaptations

L.8.3.title: Sophisticated Language Use
L.8.3.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

app_support.how_supported: Students demonstrate sophisticated language use in complex narrative adaptations

L.6.5.title: Figurative Language Understanding
L.6.5.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

app_support.how_supported: Students work with figurative language from classic texts and create their own in adaptations

L.7.5.title: Advanced Figurative Language
L.7.5.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

app_support.how_supported: Students analyze and create sophisticated figurative language in their narrative adaptations

L.8.5.title: Sophisticated Language Analysis
L.8.5.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

app_support.how_supported: Students master sophisticated figurative language and complex word relationships in advanced adaptations

literary_terms.definition: A work that transforms elements from a source text
The central message or meaning of a literary work
How a character changes or grows throughout a story
The time and place in which a story occurs
The sequence of events in a story
The perspective from which a story is told
Language that uses figures of speech for effect
Methods used by authors to tell their stories
